1957009000 Headquarter Building Menu 1957009200 Includes all buildings that belong to the government district. 1957009001 Presidential Palace 1957009201 What looks like a copy of the royal palace houses the seat of government including the presidential suite. 1957009002 Presidential Palace 1957009202 Bus connection to the Presidential Palace 1957009203 Camouflage building (enter at your own risk) 1957009204 Really? Office 1957009011 Ministry (Main Building) 1957009211 The central building to house the ministerial bureaucracy 1957009012 Personnel Office 1957009212 All personnel issues are regulated here: hiring and firing of employees, diets, works council, canteen, ... 1957009013 Press Office 1957009213 Government work is whitewashed here. 1957009014 Supreme Court 1957009214 Highest instance of jurisprudence, corrective for legislative botches, barrier against enemies of the state and all too often citizens' last hope for justice 1957009015 Justice 1957009215 Unfortunately, people's need for justice is far too often underestimated. 1957009016 Secret Service Headquarters 1957009216 Everything top secret: tasks, activities, staff, ... and above all the budget! 1957009017 Consulate for the New World 1957009217 A kind of headquarters branch for the distant corners of the empire 1957009018 Consulate for Enbesa 1957009218 A kind of headquarters branch for the distant corners of the empire Ministry of Foreign Affairs 1957009251 Secures and increases geostrategic power and global influence. 1957009052 Buff: Ministry of Military Affairs 1957009252 Of course only used for defense. And special military operations! 1957009053 Buff: Ministry of Traineeal Affairs 1957009253 Popularly called “The Octopus”. 1957009054 Buff: Ministry of Trade 1957009254 Follows the principle “Freedom = Freedom of the Markets”. 1957009056 Buff: Ministry of Finance 1957009256 The state gave it, the state took it away. 1957009057 Buff: Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs 1957009257 Combats the shortage of skilled workers - sometimes with dubious methods - and aims to ensure social balance. 1957009058 Buff: Ministry of Industry 1957009258 Now people are spitting in their hands again... 1957009059 Buff: Ministry of Entertainment 1957009259 Should always put you in a good mood. 1957009060 Buff: Ministry of Energy 1957009260 So that no one has to freeze in winter... 1957009061 Buff: Ministry of Education and Science 1957009261 Aims to promote educational equality, young scientists and future research. 1957009062 Buff: Ministry of Agriculture 1957009262 The powerful agricultural lobby is cleaning the doors here. 1957009063 Buff: Ministry of Culture 1957009263 Serves the maintenance and search for cultural treasures. 1957009064 Buff: Ministry of Health and Nutrition 1957009264 So that this doesn't become a contradiction... 1957009066 Buff: Ministry of Transport 1957009266 Critics claim that the biggest sucks are always busy here. 1957009067 Buff: Ministry of Communications 1957009267 No more snail mail and dead spots! 1957009188 Government Spokesman 1957009488 Unofficial title: Minister of Propaganda 1957009189 Agent X-007 1957009489 A legend of the shadow world: hated by his enemies, feared by his superiors, idolized by beautiful women. 1957009190 Agent undercover 1957009490 A dozen false passports, over 100 aliases, but no one knows his true identity. 1957009191 Double Agent ??? 1957009491 He lives in a world in which he doesn't exist, twice. 1957009192 Consul 1957009492 Envious people talk about a dream job: lavish expense reports, manageable workload, exotic backdrops, ... 1957009193 National Soundtrack 1957009493 The repertoire of the Presidential Music Band is essentially limited to hymns, fanfares and toots. 1957009100 President 1957009400 More than just the breakfast director? 1957009195 Newspaper special article (text) 1957009196 New Presidential Palace completed! 1957009197 After a construction period of more than 10 years, the new Presidential Palace was officially completed today at noon in [Area Current CityName].
Half a dozen serious accidents, numerous corruption scandals and a number of resignations of responsible officials characterized the construction phase. Insiders rumor that the original budget of $10,000,000 was exceeded many times over.
The outcome of a court case is also eagerly awaited, in which a plagiarism lawsuit by the architectural group responsible for the Royal Palace is being heard.< br />But despite all adversities, a two-day spectacular opening ceremony is planned for the coming weekend, to which all high-ranking personalities of the Empire as well as numerous guests from abroad are expected. 1957009198 Newspaper special article (image)
